fields.name: product
fields.description: Query method allowing you fetch a single product from the catalog.

args.name: id
args.description: The identifier of the product that should be fetched. If an invalid identifier is specified, an error is returned.

fields.name: products
fields.description: Query method allowing you fetch a batch of products from the catalog.

args.name: limit
args.description: The limit parameter limits the number of the products in a batch.The limit and offset parameters are used in conjunction to implement pagination

args.name: offset
args.description: The offset parameter offsets the product listing by the given amount. The limit and offset parameters are used in conjunction to implement pagination

fields.name: recos
fields.description: A recommender exposing the browsing history of a customer

args.name: preview
args.description: A boolean flag indicating whether you are previewing the recommendations. Enabling this will serve recommendations normally but the session will not be mutated. If no products match the recommender criteria, mock products will be returned.

args.name: image
args.description: An enum that allows specifying the image format of the products in the recommendations. The value specified here affects all recommendations in the current request.

fields.name: session
fields.description: Query method allowing you fetch the state of the current session.

args.name: id
args.description: The identifier of the session that should be fetched. If an invalid identifier is specified, an error is returned.

types.name: RecommendedProduct
types.description: A container of the details of a single product

fields.name: alternateImageUrls
fields.description: The alternative image URLs of the product

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: The custom attributes of the product

fields.name: availability
fields.description: The availability of the product

fields.name: brand

fields.name: categories

fields.name: description

fields.name: imageUrl

fields.name: listPrice
fields.description: The list price of the product

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the product

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price of the product. The price of the product is the lowest price of all it's available variants

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The currency code of the product

fields.name: productId
fields.description: The identifier of the product

fields.name: ratingValue
fields.description: The rating value of the product

fields.name: reviewCount
fields.description: The review count of the product

fields.name: skus
fields.description: The variations of the product

fields.description: The second set of tags of the product

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL of the product

fields.name: variantId
fields.description: The variant identifier of the product.

types.name: String
types.description: Built-in String

types.name: KeyValueEntity
types.description: A generic key-value pair for representing product attributes.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key of the attribute

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the attribute

types.name: Float
types.description: Built-in Float

types.name: Int
types.description: Built-in Int

types.name: RecommendedSku
types.description: A container of the details of a product's variant

fields.name: availability
fields.description: The availability of the variant

fields.name: id
fields.description: The identifier of the variant

fields.name: imageUrl

fields.name: listPrice

types.name: RecoQueryEntity
types.description: A container encapsulating all the raw recommenders available. These recommenders are not pre-configured and are parameterised. These recommenders should be used for advanced use cases.

fields.name: live
fields.description: A recommender exposing the live traffic activity on the store

args.name: params
args.description: The inclusion, exclusion, threshold and variant parameters for the recommender. If products need to be excluded, included or minimum or maximum product threshold is needed, then these params must be specified.

fields.name: random
fields.description: A recommender exposing a random result set for debugging purposes

args.name: params
args.description: The inclusion, exclusion, threshold and variant parameters for the recommender. If products need to be excluded, included or minimum or maximum product threshold is needed, then these params must be specified.

fields.name: related
fields.description: A recommender exposing cross sells for a specified product

args.name: productIds
args.description: The list of product identifiers for which related products should be recommended.

args.name: relationship
args.description: The relation factor can be used to recommend products that are viewed together, bought together or smart relations (with a weightage on buys.)

args.name: params
args.description: The inclusion, exclusion, threshold and variant parameters for the recommender. If products need to be excluded, included or minimum or maximum product threshold is needed, then these params must be specified.

fields.name: search
fields.description: A recommender exposing search related recommendations

args.name: term
args.description: The current search term that is used when find related products.

args.name: params
args.description: The inclusion, exclusion, threshold and variant parameters for the recommender. If products need to be excluded, included or minimum or maximum product threshold is needed, then these params must be specified.

fields.name: toplist
fields.description: A recommender exposing the most popular products on the store

args.name: hours
args.description: The period (in hours) for which the toplist is to be recommended. A default value of 168 i.e. a week, is suggested. A maximum period length of a month can be specified

args.name: sort
args.description: The scoring mode can be used to return the most viewed products ot the most bought products.

args.name: params
args.description: The inclusion, exclusion, threshold and variant parameters for the recommender. If products need to be excluded, included or minimum or maximum product threshold is needed, then these params must be specified.

types.name: RecommenderResult
types.description: A container for the response of a recommender

fields.name: primary
fields.description: The list of primary results returned by the recommender.

types.name: InputRecommenderParams

inputFields.name: exclude

inputFields.name: include
inputFields.description: The inclusion boundaries of products required from the recommender

inputFields.name: maxProducts

inputFields.name: minProducts
inputFields.description: The minimum number of the products required from the recommender

inputFields.name: variantId
inputFields.description: The variation of the products required from the recommender

inputFields.name: tags2

inputFields.name: tags3
inputFields.description: The third set of tags used for inclusion or exclusion

types.description: A container for containing information about the inclusion or exclusion parameters

inputFields.name: brands

inputFields.name: fresh
inputFields.description: A boolean value denoting the inclusion of new products

types.name: Session
types.description: The details of the current session after it has been mutated. The session contains all known information about the customer and can also be used to fetch recommendations related to the session.

fields.name: cart
fields.description: The details of the current customer's shopping cart. This drastically improves the recommender performance.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The details of the currently logged-in customer. This is primarily used for email remarketing.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique customer identifier as provided by the recommender. This value should be persisted and reused for every request.

fields.name: recos
fields.description: The recommendations that should be returned after the session has been updated.

args.name: preview
args.description: A boolean flag indicating whether you are previewing the recommendations. Enabling this will serve recommendations normally but the session will not be mutated. If no products match the recommender criteria, mock products will be returned.

args.name: image
args.description: An enum that allows specifying the image format of the products in the recommendations. The value specified here affects all recommendations in the current request.

fields.name: events
fields.description: The list of events to be dispatched. Usually a single event is dispatched.

types.name: Cart
types.description: The itemised details of the customer's current shopping cart contents.

fields.name: items
fields.description: An array of items denoting the customer's current shopping cart

types.name: Item
types.description: The details of the single line item in thr shopping cart.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the product in the shopping cart. This name needs to represent the name of actual variation that was added to the cart. This field is optional and only used for abandoned-cart emails.

fields.name: priceCurrencyCode
fields.description: The currency code of the product in the shopping cart. This currency code needs to represent the price of actual line item that was added to the cart.

fields.name: productId
fields.description: The identifier of the product in the shopping cart. This identifier needs to represent the identifier of the parent product.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the product in the shopping cart. This quantity needs to represent the quantity of the actual line item that was added to the cart..

fields.name: skuId
fields.description: The identifier of the variation in the shopping cart. This identifier needs to represent the identifier of the actual variation. This field is optional but drastically enhances the performance of the recommender engine.

fields.name: unitPrice
fields.description: The price of the product in the shopping cart. This unit price needs to represent the price of actual line item that was added to the cart.

types.name: CustomerInfoEntity
types.description: A container containing the details personal details of a logged-in customer.

fields.name: customerReference
fields.description: A unique non-guessable customer reference such the hash of the customer'sloyalty program identifier. This is used to merge sessions across devices.While an email address can be used to uniquely identify a customer, it isn'tused, as it is a rather guessable identifier.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address of the currently logged in user. The email address isoptional and primarily used for email remarketing.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The first name of the currently logged in user. The first name is optionaland and primarily used for email remarketing.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The last name of the currently logged in user. The last name is optionaland and primarily used for email remarketing.

fields.name: marketingPermission
fields.description: A boolean indicating whether the customer has consented to receivingemail remarketing. If unspecified, this will default to false.

types.name: RecoRequestEntity
types.description: A container encapsulating all the raw recommenders available. These recommenders are not pre-configured and are parameterised. These recommenders should be used for advanced use cases.

fields.description: A recommender exposing the browsing history of a customer

args.description: The inclusion, exclusion, threshold and variant parameters for the recommender. If products need to be excluded, included or minimum or maximum product threshold is needed, then these params must be specified.

fields.name: toplist

args.description: The period (in hours) for which the toplist is to be recommended. A default value of 168 i.e. a week, is suggested. A maximum period length of a month can be specified

args.description: The inclusion, exclusion, threshold and variant parameters for the recommender. If products need to be excluded, included or minimum or maximum product threshold is needed, then these params must be specified.

types.name: Event
types.description: An object used for denoting an interaction event such as product view or a search

fields.name: target
fields.description: The details of the event that needs to be dispatched for example, when viewing a product, the target is the identifier of the product; when viewing a category the target is the path of the category, and, when invoking a search the target is the actual search term. It is imperative that these events be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the event that needs to be dispatched for example, viewing a product, viewing a category and invoking a search. It is imperative that these events be sent.

enumValues.name: VIEWED_PRODUCT
enumValues.description: VIEWED_PRODUCT

enumValues.name: VIEWED_CATEGORY
enumValues.description: VIEWED_CATEGORY

enumValues.name: SEARCHED_FOR
enumValues.description: SEARCHED_FOR

types.name: InputSessionParams
types.description: The schemas entry-point for mutations. This acts as the public, top-level API from which all recommender queries must start.

inputFields.name: cart
inputFields.description: The itemised details of the customer's shopping cart. This should be always sent as the shopping cart contents provides intelligence to the recommender system and skews the recommendations.

inputFields.name: customer
inputFields.description: The details of the currently logged in customer. This is optional and primarily used for merging sessions and for use in email remarketing.

inputFields.name: event
inputFields.description: The details of the customer's current interaction with the page. When viewing products, categories or when searching, this field must be populated. The recommender gains intelligence using these events and omitting this will result in a steady decline in recommender performance.

types.name: InputCart
types.description: The itemised details of the customer's current shopping cart contents.

inputFields.name: items
inputFields.description: An array of items denoting the customer's current shopping cart

types.name: InputItem
types.description: The details of the single line item in thr shopping cart.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the product in the shopping cart. This name needs to represent the name of actual variation that was added to the cart. This field is optional and only used for abandoned-cart emails.

inputFields.name: priceCurrencyCode
inputFields.description: The currency code of the product in the shopping cart. This currency code needs to represent the price of actual line item that was added to the cart.

inputFields.name: productId
inputFields.description: The identifier of the product in the shopping cart. This identifier needs to represent the identifier of the parent product.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The quantity of the product in the shopping cart. This quantity needs to represent the quantity of the actual line item that was added to the cart..

inputFields.name: skuId
inputFields.description: The identifier of the variation in the shopping cart. This identifier needs to represent the identifier of the actual variation. This field is optional but drastically enhances the performance of the recommender engine.

inputFields.name: unitPrice
inputFields.description: The price of the product in the shopping cart. This unit price needs to represent the price of actual line item that was added to the cart.

types.description: A container containing the details personal details of a logged-in customer.

inputFields.name: customerReference
inputFields.description: A unique non-guessable customer reference such the hash of the customer'sloyalty program identifier. This is used to merge sessions across devices.While an email address can be used to uniquely identify a customer, it isn'tused, as it is a rather guessable identifier.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The email address of the currently logged in user. The email address isoptional and primarily used for email remarketing.

inputFields.name: firstName

inputFields.name: lastName

inputFields.name: marketingPermission

types.name: InputEvent
types.description: An object used for denoting an interaction event such as product view or a search

inputFields.name: target
inputFields.description: The details of the event that needs to be dispatched for example, when viewing a product, the target is the identifier of the product; when viewing a category the target is the path of the category, and, when invoking a search the target is the actual search term. It is imperative that these events be sent.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The type of the event that needs to be dispatched for example, viewing a product, viewing a category and invoking a search. It is imperative that these events be sent.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema IDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar IDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface IDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field IDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
